name: py-dendropy

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
DendroPy is a Python library for phylogenetic computing. It provides
classes and functions for the simulation, processing, and manipulation
of phylogenetic trees and character matrices, and supports the reading
and writing of phylogenetic data in a range of formats, such as NEXUS,
NEWICK, NeXML, Phylip, FASTA, etc.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependent_to.name: pasta
dependent_to.description: PASTA (Practical Alignment using SATe and Transitivity)

dependent_to.name: py-metaphlan
dependent_to.description:
MetaPhlAn is a computational tool for profiling the composition of
microbial communities (Bacteria, Archaea and Eukaryotes) from
metagenomic shotgun sequencing data (i.e. not 16S) with species-level.

dependent_to.name: py-phylophlan
dependent_to.description:
PhyloPhlAn 3.0 is an integrated pipeline for large-scale phylogenetic
profiling of genomes and metagenomes.

dependent_to.name: sepp
dependent_to.description: SEPP stands for SATe-enabled phylogenetic placement

dependent_to.name: py-checkm-genome
dependent_to.description:
Assess the quality of microbial genomes recovered from isolates, single
cells, and metagenomes

dependent_to.name: py-gtdbtk
dependent_to.description:
GTDB-Tk is a software toolkit for assigning objective taxonomic
classifications to bacterial and archaeal genomes based on the Genome
Database Taxonomy (GTDB).
